page.title: 18DALRY (KIRK)CHURCH CUSTOMS
page.content: After weddings in Dalry church ,the womenfolk line the church avenue to see the bride. At funerals men in dark suits and black ties walk in procession behind the hearse. In the kirkyard they line the route to the grave. Eight close associates of the deceased each take a cord and so symbolically help to lower the coffin into the ground. Communion Services are held twice a year.On the Sunday before Communion young people and others who have received instruction from the minister, become church members officially.The right hand of fellowship is extended to them first by the minister and then by each of the elders in turn.
